standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114372D
standard.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143769
standard.description: Key Ideas and Details

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114376D
standard.description: 1. Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114376E
standard.description: 2. Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114376F
standard.description: 3. Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114376A
standard.description: Craft and Structure

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143770
standard.description: 4. Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143771
standard.description: 5. Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143772
standard.description: 6. Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114376B
standard.description: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143773
standard.description: 7. Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143774
standard.description: 8. Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143775
standard.description: 9. Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114376C
standard.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143776
standard.description: 10. Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436A5
standard.description: Reading Standards for Literature

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436AE
standard.description: Key Ideas and Details

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B2
standard.description: 1. With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B3
standard.description: 2. With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B4
standard.description: 3. With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B5
standard.description: 1. Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B6
standard.description: 2. Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate understanding of their central message or lesson.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B7
standard.description: 3. Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using key details.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B8
standard.description: 1. Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B9
standard.description: 2. Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures, and determine their central message, lesson, or moral.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436BA
standard.description: 3. Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436BB
standard.description: 1. Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436BC
standard.description: 2. Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436BD
standard.description: 3. Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436BE
standard.description: 1. Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436BF
standard.description: 2. Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C0
standard.description: 3. Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character's thoughts, words, or actions).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C1
standard.description: 1. Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C2
standard.description: 2. Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C3
standard.description: 3. Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143777
standard.description: 1. Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143778
standard.description: 2. Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143779
standard.description: 3. Describe how a particular story's or drama's plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114377A
standard.description: 1. Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114377B
standard.description: 2. Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114377C
standard.description: 3. Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114377D
standard.description: 1. Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114377E
standard.description: 2. Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114377F
standard.description: 3. Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143780
standard.description: 1. Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143781
standard.description: 2. Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze in detail its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143782
standard.description: 3. Analyze how complex characters (e.g., those with multiple or conflicting motivations) develop over the course of a text, interact with other characters, and advance the plot or develop the theme.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143783
standard.description: 1. Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143784
standard.description: 2. Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143785
standard.description: 3. Analyze the impact of the author's choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436AF
standard.description: Craft and Structure

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C4
standard.description: 4. Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C5
standard.description: 5. Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C6
standard.description: 6. With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C7
standard.description: 4. Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C8
standard.description: 5. Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text types.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436C9
standard.description: 6. Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436CA
standard.description: 4. Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436CB
standard.description: 5. Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436CC
standard.description: 6. Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436CD
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436CE
standard.description: 5. Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436CF
standard.description: 6. Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D0
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including those that allude to significant characters found in mythology (e.g., Herculean).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D1
standard.description: 5. Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D2
standard.description: 6. Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D3
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D4
standard.description: 5. Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D5
standard.description: 6. Describe how a narrator's or speaker's point of view influences how events are described.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143786
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143787
standard.description: 5. Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143788
standard.description: 6. Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143789
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114378A
standard.description: 5. Analyze how a drama's or poem's form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114378B
standard.description: 6. Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114378C
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114378D
standard.description: 5. Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114378E
standard.description: 6. Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114378F
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language evokes a sense of time and place; how it sets a formal or informal tone).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143790
standard.description: 5. Analyze how an author's choices concerning how to structure a text, order events within it (e.g., parallel plots), and manipulate time (e.g., pacing, flashbacks) create such effects as mystery, tension, or surprise.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143791
standard.description: 6. Analyze a particular point of view or cultural experience reflected in a work of literature from outside the United States, drawing on a wide reading of world literature.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143792
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings or language that is particularly fresh, engaging, or beautiful. (Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.)

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143793
standard.description: 5. Analyze how an author's choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text (e.g., the choice of where to begin or end a story, the choice to provide a comedic or tragic resolution) contribute to its overall structure and meaning as well as its aesthetic impact.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143794
standard.description: 6. Analyze a case in which grasping point of view requires distinguishing what is directly stated in a text from what is really meant (e.g., satire, sarcasm, irony, or understatement).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436B0
standard.description: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D6
standard.description: 7. With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D7
standard.description: 8. (Not applicable to literature)

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D8
standard.description: 9. With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436D9
standard.description: 7. Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436DA
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436DB
standard.description: 7. Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436DC
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors or from different cultures.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436DD
standard.description: 7. Explain how specific aspects of a text's illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436DE
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436DF
standard.description: 7. Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E0
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E1
standard.description: 7. Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E2
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143795
standard.description: 7. Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they "see" and "hear" when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143796
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143797
standard.description: 7. Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143798
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143799
standard.description: 7. Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114379A
standard.description: 9. Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114379B
standard.description: 7. Analyze the representation of a subject or a key scene in two different artistic mediums, including what is emphasized or absent in each treatment (e.g., Auden's "MusÃ©e des Beaux Arts" and Breughel's Landscape with the Fall of Icarus).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114379C
standard.description: 9. Analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work (e.g., how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114379D
standard.description: 7. Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or poetry), evaluating how each version interprets the source text. (Include at least one play by Shakespeare and one play by an American dramatist.)

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114379E
standard.description: 9. Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics.

standard.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E3
standard.description: 10. Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E4
standard.description: 10. With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of appropriate complexity for grade 1.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E5
standard.description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories and poetry, in the grades 2-3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E6
standard.description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 2-3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E7
standard.description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in the grades 4-5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436E8
standard.description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 4-5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114379F
standard.description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2363567
standard.description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6â€“8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A0
standard.description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at the high end of grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.description: 2. With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

standard.description: 3. With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436F0
standard.description: 1. Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436F1
standard.description: 2. Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436F2
standard.description: 3. Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436F3
standard.description: 1. Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

standard.description: 3. Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.

standard.description: 3. Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436F9
standard.description: 1. Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436FA
standard.description: 2. Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details; summarize the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436FB
standard.description: 3. Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436FC
standard.description: 1. Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436FD
standard.description: 2. Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details; summarize the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436FE
standard.description: 3. Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A6
standard.description: 1. Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A7
standard.description: 2. Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A8
standard.description: 3. Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A9
standard.description: 1. Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437AA
standard.description: 2. Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437AB
standard.description: 3. Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437AC
standard.description: 1. Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437AD
standard.description: 2. Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437AE
standard.description: 3. Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437AF
standard.description: 1. Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B0
standard.description: 2. Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including how it emerges and is shaped and refined by specific details; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B1
standard.description: 3. Analyze how the author unfolds an analysis or series of ideas or events, including the order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the connections that are drawn between them.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B2
standard.description: 1. Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B3
standard.description: 2. Determine two or more central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to provide a complex analysis; provide an objective summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B4
standard.description: 3. Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and develop over the course of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436EA
standard.description: Craft and Structure

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436FF
standard.description: 4. With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143700
standard.description: 5. Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143701
standard.description: 6. Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143702
standard.description: 4. Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143703
standard.description: 5. Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143704
standard.description: 6. Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143705
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143706
standard.description: 5. Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143707
standard.description: 6. Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143708
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143709
standard.description: 5. Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114370A
standard.description: 6. Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114370B
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114370C
standard.description: 5. Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114370D
standard.description: 6. Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114370E
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114370F
standard.description: 5. Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143710
standard.description: 6. Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B5
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B6
standard.description: 5. Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B7
standard.description: 6. Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B8
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437B9
standard.description: 5. Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437BA
standard.description: 6. Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437BB
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437BC
standard.description: 5. Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437BD
standard.description: 6. Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437BE
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language of a court opinion differs from that of a newspaper).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437BF
standard.description: 5. Analyze in detail how an author's ideas or claims are developed and refined by particular sentences, paragraphs, or larger portions of a text (e.g., a section or chapter).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C0
standard.description: 6. Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how an author uses rhetoric to advance that point of view or purpose.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C1
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term or terms over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C2
standard.description: 5. Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of the structure an author uses in his or her exposition or argument, including whether the structure makes points clear, convincing, and engaging.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C3
standard.description: 6. Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text in which the rhetoric is particularly effective, analyzing how style and content contribute to the power, persuasiveness, or beauty of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436EB
standard.description: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143711
standard.description: 7. With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143712
standard.description: 8. With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143713
standard.description: 9. With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143714
standard.description: 7. Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143715
standard.description: 8. Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143716
standard.description: 9. Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143717
standard.description: 7. Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143718
standard.description: 8. Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143719
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114371A
standard.description: 7. Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114371B
standard.description: 8. Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114371C
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114371D
standard.description: 7. Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114371E
standard.description: 8. Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114371F
standard.description: 9. Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143720
standard.description: 7. Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143721
standard.description: 8. Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143722
standard.description: 9. Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C4
standard.description: 7. Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C5
standard.description: 8. Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C6
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast one author's presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C7
standard.description: 7. Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium's portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C8
standard.description: 8. Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437C9
standard.description: 9. Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437CA
standard.description: 7. Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437CB
standard.description: 8. Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437CC
standard.description: 9. Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437CD
standard.description: 7. Analyze various accounts of a subject told in different mediums (e.g., a person's life story in both print and multimedia), determining which details are emphasized in each account.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437CE
standard.description: 8. Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437CF
standard.description: 9. Analyze seminal U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (e.g., Washington's Farewell Address, the Gettysburg Address, Roosevelt's Four Freedoms speech, King's "Letter from Birmingham Jail"), including how they address related themes and concepts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437D0
standard.description: 7. Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words in order to address a question or solve a problem.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437D1
standard.description: 8. Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning (e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437D2
standard.description: 9. Analyze seventeenth-, eighteenth-, and nineteenth-century foundational U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (including The Declaration of Independence, the Preamble to the Constitution, the Bill of Rights, and Lincoln's Second Inaugural Address) for their themes, purposes, and rhetorical features.

standard.description: a. Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114373D
standard.description: d. Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

standard.description: 1. Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114375E
standard.description: a. Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g., first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

standard.description: Phonological Awareness

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143733
standard.description: 2. Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114373F
standard.description: a. Recognize and produce rhyming words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143740
standard.description: b. Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143741
standard.description: c. Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143742
standard.description: d. Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonent-vowel-consonent, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143743
standard.description: e. Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

standard.description: 2. Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114375F
standard.description: a. Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143760
standard.description: b. Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds (phonemes), including consonant blends.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143761
standard.description: c. Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143762
standard.description: d. Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114374A
standard.description: c. Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

standard.description: d. Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

standard.description: 3. Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114374E

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114374F
standard.description: d. Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143750
standard.description: e. Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by breaking the words into syllables.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143751
standard.description: f. Read words with inflectional endings.

standard.description: g. Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

standard.description: 3. Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

standard.description: a. Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A3
standard.description: Reading Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies 6-12

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143A9C
standard.description: Key Ideas and Details

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA0
standard.description: 1. Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA1
standard.description: 2. Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA2
standard.description: 3. Identify key steps in a text's description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA3
standard.description: 1. Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, attending to such features as the date and origin of the information.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA4
standard.description: 2. Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of how key events or ideas develop over the course of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA5
standard.description: 3. Analyze in detail a series of events described in a text; determine whether earlier events caused later ones or simply preceded them.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA6
standard.description: 1. Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, connecting insights gained from specific details to an understanding of the text as a whole.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA7
standard.description: 2. Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary that makes clear the relationships among the key details and ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA8
standard.description: 3. Evaluate various explanations for actions or events and determine which explanation best accords with textual evidence, acknowledging where the text leaves matters uncertain.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143A9D
standard.description: Craft and Structure

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AA9
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including vocabulary specific to domains related to history/social studies.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AAA
standard.description: 5. Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AAB
standard.description: 6. Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author's point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AAC
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including vocabulary describing political, social, or economic aspects of history/social studies.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AAD
standard.description: 5. Analyze how a text uses structure to emphasize key points or advance an explanation or analysis

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AAE
standard.description: 6. Compare the point of view of two or more authors for how they treat the same or similar topics, including which details they include and emphasize in their respective accounts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AAF
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB0
standard.description: 5. Analyze in detail how a complex primary source is structured, including how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text contribute to the whole.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB1
standard.description: 6. Evaluate authors' differing points of view on the same historical event or issue by assessing the authors' claims, reasoning, and evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143A9E
standard.description: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB2
standard.description: 7. Integrate visual information (e.g., in charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) with other information in print and digital texts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB3
standard.description: 8. Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB4
standard.description: 9. Analyze the relationship between a primary and secondary source on the same topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB5
standard.description: 7. Integrate quantitative or technical analysis (e.g., charts, research data) with qualitative analysis in print or digital text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB6
standard.description: 8. Assess the extent to which the reasoning and evidence in a text support the author's claims.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB7
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast treatments of the same topic in several primary and secondary sources.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB8
standard.description: 7. Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AB9
standard.description: 8. Evaluate an author's premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ABA
standard.description: 9. Integrate information from diverse sources, both primary and secondary, into a coherent understanding of an idea or event, noting discrepancies among sources.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143A9F
standard.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ABB
standard.description: 10. By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ABC
standard.description: 10. By the end of grade 10, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ABD
standard.description: 10. By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 11-CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A4
standard.description: Reading Standards for Literacy in Science and Technical Subjects 6-12

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ABE
standard.description: Key Ideas and Details

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC2
standard.description: 1. Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC3
standard.description: 2. Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC4
standard.description: 3. Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC6
standard.description: 1. Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to the precise details of explanations or descriptions.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC7
standard.description: 2. Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; trace the text's explanation or depiction of a complex process, phenomenon, or concept; provide an accurate summary of the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC8
standard.description: 3. Follow precisely a complex multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks, attending to special cases or exceptions defined in the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC9
standard.description: 1. Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to important distinctions the author makes and to any gaps or inconsistencies in the account.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ACA
standard.description: 2. Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; summarize complex concepts, processes, or information presented in a text by paraphrasing them in simpler but still accurate terms.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ACB
standard.description: 3. Follow precisely a complex multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks; analyze the specific results based on explanations in the text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ABF
standard.description: Craft and Structure

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC5
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 6-8 texts and topics.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ACC
standard.description: 5. Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ACD
standard.description: 6. Analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ACE
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 9-10 texts and topics.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ACF
standard.description: 5. Analyze the structure of the relationships among concepts in a text, including relationships among key terms (e.g., force, friction, reaction force, energy).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD0
standard.description: 6. Analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, defining the question the author seeks to address.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD1
standard.description: 4. Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 11-12 texts and topics.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD2
standard.description: 5. Analyze how the text structures information or ideas into categories or hierarchies, demonstrating understanding of the information or ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD3
standard.description: 6. Analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, identifying important issues that remain unresolved.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC0
standard.description: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD4
standard.description: 7. Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD5
standard.description: 8. Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD6
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast the information gained from experiments, simulations, video, or multimedia sources with that gained from reading a text on the same topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD7
standard.description: 7. Translate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text into visual form (e.g., a table or chart) and translate information expressed visually or mathematically (e.g., in an equation) into words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD8
standard.description: 8. Assess the extent to which the reasoning and evidence in a text support the author's claim or a recommendation for solving a scientific or technical problem.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AD9
standard.description: 9. Compare and contrast findings presented in a text to those from other sources (including their own experiments), noting when the findings support or contradict previous explanations or accounts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ADA
standard.description: 7. Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., quantitative data, video, multimedia) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ADB
standard.description: 8. Evaluate the hypotheses, data, analysis, and conclusions in a science or technical text, verifying the data when possible and corroborating or challenging conclusions with other sources of information.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ADC
standard.description: 9. Synthesize information from a range of sources (e.g., texts, experiments, simulations) into a coherent understanding of a process, phenomenon, or concept, resolving conflicting information when possible.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AC1
standard.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ADD
standard.description: 10. By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ADE
standard.description: 10. By the end of grade 10, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 9-10 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143ADF
standard.description: 10. By the end of grade 12, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 11-CCR text complexity band independently and proficiently.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143768
standard.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C0
standard.description: Text Types and Purposes

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438CB
standard.description: 1. Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438CC
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438CD
standard.description: 3. Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C1
standard.description: Production and Distribution of Writing

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C8
standard.description: 4. Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C9
standard.description: 5. Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438CA
standard.description: 6. Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C2
standard.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C5
standard.description: 7. Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C6
standard.description: 8. Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C7
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C3
standard.description: Range of Writing

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438C4
standard.description: 10. Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436A8
standard.description: Writing Standards

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143936
standard.description: Text Types and Purposes

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114393C
standard.description: 1. Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is ...).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114393D
standard.description: 2. Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114393E
standard.description: 3. Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114393F
standard.description: 1. Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name the book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply a reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143940
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143941
standard.description: 3. Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately sequenced events, include some details regarding what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of closure.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143942
standard.description: 1. Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g., because, and, also) to connect opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement or section.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143943
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide a concluding statement or section.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143944
standard.description: 3. Write narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143945
standard.description: 1. Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143946
standard.description: a. Introduce the topic or text they are writing about, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143947
standard.description: b. Provide reasons that support the opinion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143948
standard.description: c. Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143949
standard.description: d. Provide a concluding statement or section.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114394A
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114394B
standard.description: a. Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114394C
standard.description: b. Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114394D
standard.description: c. Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114394E
standard.description: d. Provide a concluding statement or section.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114394F
standard.description: 3. Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143950
standard.description: a. Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143951
standard.description: b. Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143952
standard.description: c. Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143953
standard.description: d. Provide a sense of closure.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143954
standard.description: 1. Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143955
standard.description: a. Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer's purpose.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143956
standard.description: b. Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143957
standard.description: c. Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143958
standard.description: d. Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

standard.description: a. Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114397C

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364872

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364875
standard.description: f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented

standard.description: 3. Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364879
standard.description: a. Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143987

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143989
