standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114398E
standard.description: 1. Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143991
standard.description: a. Introduce precise claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that establishes clear relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143993
standard.description: b. Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly, supplying evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience's knowledge level and concerns.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143995
standard.description: c. Use words, phrases, and clauses to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143997
standard.description: d. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143998
standard.description: e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114398F
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143999
standard.description: a. Introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information to make important connections and distinctions; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114399B
standard.description: b. Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114399D
standard.description: c. Use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114399F
standard.description: d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A1
standard.description: e. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A2
standard.description: f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143990
standard.description: 3. Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A3
standard.description: a. Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A5
standard.description: b. Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A6
standard.description: c. Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A8
standard.description: d. Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A9
standard.description: e. Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364881
standard.description: 1. Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143992
standard.description: a. Introduce precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establish the significance of the claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that logically sequences claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143994
standard.description: b. Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143996
standard.description: c. Use words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364884
standard.description: d. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364885
standard.description: e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364882
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114399A
standard.description: a. Introduce a topic; organize complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114399C
standard.description: b. Develop the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114399E
standard.description: c. Use appropriate and varied transitions and syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A0
standard.description: d. Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary, and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364886
standard.description: e. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364887
standard.description: f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364883
standard.description: 3. Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A4
standard.description: a. Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation and its significance, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364888
standard.description: b. Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439A7
standard.description: c. Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole and build toward a particular tone and outcome (e.g., a sense of mystery, suspense, growth, or resolution).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364889
standard.description: d. Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364890
standard.description: e. Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143937
standard.description: Production and Distribution of Writing

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439AA
standard.description: 4. (Begins in grade 3)

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439AB
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439AC
standard.description: 6. With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439AD
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364930
standard.description: 6. With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439AF
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a topic and strengthen writing as needed by revising and editing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439AE
standard.description: 6. With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B0
standard.description: 4. With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B1
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B2
standard.description: 6. With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B3
standard.description: 4. Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364931
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B4
standard.description: 6. With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364932
standard.description: 4. Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B5
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B6
standard.description: 6. With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439BC
standard.description: 4. Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B7
standard.description: 5. With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439B8
standard.description: 6. Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

standard.description: 6. Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

standard.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C0
standard.description: 7. Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364939
standard.description: 8. With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C3
standard.description: 7. Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of "how-to" books on a given topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C1
standard.description: 8. With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C4
standard.description: 7. Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C5
standard.description: 8. Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C6
standard.description: 7. Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C7
standard.description: 8. Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C2
standard.description: 9. (Begins in grade 4)

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C8
standard.description: 7. Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439C9
standard.description: 8. Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes and categorize information, and provide a list of sources.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439CC
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439CD
standard.description: a. Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character's thoughts, words, or actions].").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439CE
standard.description: b. Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., "Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439CA
standard.description: 7. Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439CB
standard.description: 8. Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and provide a list of sources.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364942
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439CF
standard.description: a. Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or a drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., how characters interact]").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D0
standard.description: b. Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., "Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point[s]").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D1
standard.description: 7. Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D2
standard.description: 8. Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364943
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D6
standard.description: a. Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres [e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories] in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D7
standard.description: b. Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., "Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D3
standard.description: 7. Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364940
standard.description: 8. Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364944
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D8
standard.description: a. Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D9
standard.description: b. Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g. "Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D5
standard.description: 7. Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439D4
standard.description: 8. Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364945
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439DA
standard.description: a. Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439DB
standard.description: b. Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., "Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439DC
standard.description: 7. Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439DD
standard.description: 8. Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the usefulness of each source in answering the research question; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364946
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439DF
standard.description: a. Apply grades 9-10 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work [e.g., how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author draws on a play by Shakespeare]").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439E0
standard.description: b. Apply grades 9-10 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., "Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is valid and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; identify false statements and fallacious reasoning").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364941
standard.description: 7. Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439DE
standard.description: 8. Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and over-reliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364947
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439E1
standard.description: a. Apply grades 11-12 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11439E2
standard.description: b. Apply grades 11-12 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., "Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning [e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court Case majority opinions and dissents] and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy [e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses]").

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437A5
standard.description: Writing Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects 6-12

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AE0
standard.description: Text Types and Purposes

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF1
standard.description: 1. Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF2
standard.description: a. Introduce claim(s) about a topic or issue, acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF3
standard.description: b. Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant, accurate data and evidence that demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text, using credible sources.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF4
standard.description: c. Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF5
standard.description: d. Establish and maintain a formal style.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364836
standard.description: e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AFE
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AFF
standard.description: a. Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories as appropriate to achieving purpose; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B00
standard.description: b. Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B01
standard.description: c. Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B02
standard.description: d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B03
standard.description: e. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B04
standard.description: f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364833
standard.description: 1. Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF6
standard.description: a. Introduce precise claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that establishes clear relationships among the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF7
standard.description: b. Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly, supplying data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form and in a manner that anticipates the audience's knowledge level and concerns.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF8
standard.description: c. Use words, phrases, and clauses to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364835
standard.description: d. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364837
standard.description: e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364838
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B05
standard.description: a. Introduce a topic and organize ideas, concepts, and information to make important connections and distinctions; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B06
standard.description: b. Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B07
standard.description: c. Use varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B08
standard.description: d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the topic and convey a style appropriate to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B09
standard.description: e. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B0A
standard.description: f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364834
standard.description: 1. Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AF9
standard.description: a. Introduce precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establish the significance of the claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that logically sequences the claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AFA
standard.description: b. Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant data and evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both claim(s) and counterclaims in a discipline-appropriate form that anticipates the audience's knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AFB
standard.description: c. Use words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AFC
standard.description: d. Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AFD
standard.description: e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364839
standard.description: 2. Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B0B
standard.description: a. Introduce a topic and organize complex ideas, concepts, and information so that each new element builds on that which precedes it to create a unified whole; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., figures, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B0C
standard.description: b. Develop the topic thoroughly by selecting the most significant and relevant facts, extended definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the audience's knowledge of the topic.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B0D
standard.description: c. Use varied transitions and sentence structures to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B0E
standard.description: d. Use precise language, domain-specific vocabulary and techniques such as metaphor, simile, and analogy to manage the complexity of the topic; convey a knowledgeable stance in a style that responds to the discipline and context as well as to the expertise of likely readers.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143B0F
standard.description: e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation provided (e.g., articulating implications or the significance of the topic).

Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using advanced searches effectively; assess the strengths and limitations of each source in terms of the specific task, purpose, and audience; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of ideas, avoiding plagiarism and over-reliance on any one source and following a standard format for citation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364845
standard.description: 9. Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AE3
standard.description: Range of Writing

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143AE4
standard.description: 10. Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364846
standard.description: 10. Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364847
standard.description: 10. Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437D7
standard.description: Comprehension and Collaboration

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437D9
standard.description: 1. Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437DA
standard.description: 2. Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437DB
standard.description: 3. Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437D8
standard.description: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437DC
standard.description: 4. Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437DD
standard.description: 5. Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437DE
standard.description: 6. Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11436A9
standard.description: Speaking and Listening Standards

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D0
standard.description: Comprehension and Collaboration

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438CE
standard.description: 1. Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E2
standard.description: a. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E3
standard.description: b. Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438CF
standard.description: 2. Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D2
standard.description: 3. Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D3
standard.description: 1. Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E4
standard.description: a. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E5
standard.description: b. Build on others' talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E6
standard.description: c. Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D4
standard.description: 2. Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D5
standard.description: 3. Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to gather additional information or clarify something that is not understood.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D6
standard.description: 1. Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 2 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E7
standard.description: a. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E8
standard.description: b. Build on others' talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E9
standard.description: c. Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D7
standard.description: 2. Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D8
standard.description: 3. Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or issue.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438EA
standard.description: 1. Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438FC
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438FD
standard.description: b. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438FE
standard.description: c. Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438FF
standard.description: d. Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438EB
standard.description: 2. Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438EC
standard.description: 3. Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438ED
standard.description: 1. Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 4 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143900
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143901
standard.description: b. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143902
standard.description: c. Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of others.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143903
standard.description: d. Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438EE
standard.description: 2. Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438EF
standard.description: 3. Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F0
standard.description: 1. Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143904
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143905
standard.description: b. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143906
standard.description: c. Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion and elaborate on the remarks of others.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143907
standard.description: d. Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge gained from the discussions.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F1
standard.description: 2. Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F2
standard.description: 3. Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143908
standard.description: 1. Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143922
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143923
standard.description: b. Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143924
standard.description: c. Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143925
standard.description: d. Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143909
standard.description: 2. Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114390A
standard.description: 3. Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114390B
standard.description: 1. Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143926
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143927
standard.description: b. Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143928
standard.description: c. Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others' questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143929
standard.description: d. Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114390C
standard.description: 2. Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114390D
standard.description: 3. Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114390E
standard.description: 1. Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 8 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114392A
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114392B
standard.description: b. Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114392C
standard.description: c. Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others' questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114392D
standard.description: d. Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views in light of the evidence presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114390F
standard.description: 2. Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its presentation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143910
standard.description: 3. Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence and identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143918
standard.description: 1. Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grades 9-10 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114392E
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read and researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence from texts and other research on the topic or issue to stimulate a thoughtful, well-reasoned exchange of ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114392F
standard.description: b. Work with peers to set rules for collegial discussions and decision-making (e.g., informal consensus, taking votes on key issues, presentation of alternate views), clear goals and deadlines, and individual roles as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143930
standard.description: c. Propel conversations by posing and responding to questions that relate the current discussion to broader themes or larger ideas; actively incorporate others into the discussion; and clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143931
standard.description: d. Respond thoughtfully to diverse perspectives, summarize points of agreement and disagreement, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views and understanding and make new connections in light of the evidence and reasoning presented.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143919
standard.description: 2. Integrate multiple sources of information presented in diverse media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) evaluating the credibility and accuracy of each source.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114391A
standard.description: 3. Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric, identifying any fallacious reasoning or exaggerated or distorted evidence.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114391B
standard.description: 1. Initiate and participate effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grades 11-12 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143932
standard.description: a. Come to discussions prepared, having read and researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence from texts and other research on the topic or issue to stimulate a thoughtful, well-reasoned exchange of ideas.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143933
standard.description: b. Work with peers to promote civil, democratic discussions and decision-making, set clear goals and deadlines, and establish individual roles as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143934
standard.description: c. Propel conversations by posing and responding to questions that probe reasoning and evidence; ensure a hearing for a full range of positions on a topic or issue; clarify, verify, or challenge ideas and conclusions; and promote divergent and creative perspectives.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143935
standard.description: d. Respond thoughtfully to diverse perspectives; synthesize comments, claims, and evidence made on all sides of an issue; resolve contradictions when possible; and determine what additional information or research is required to deepen the investigation or complete the task.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114391C
standard.description: 2. Integrate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) in order to make informed decisions and solve problems, evaluating the credibility and accuracy of each source and noting any discrepancies among the data.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114391D
standard.description: 3. Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric, assessing the stance, premises, links among ideas, word choice, points of emphasis, and tone used.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D1
standard.description: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438D9
standard.description: 4. Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438DA
standard.description: 5. Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438DB
standard.description: 6. Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438DC
standard.description: 4. Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438DD
standard.description: 5. Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438DE
standard.description: 6. Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438DF
standard.description: 4. Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking audibly in coherent sentences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E0
standard.description: 5. Create audio recordings of stories or poems; add drawings or other visual displays to stories or recounts of experiences when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438E1
standard.description: 6. Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F3
standard.description: 4. Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F4
standard.description: 5. Create engaging audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F5
standard.description: 6. Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F6
standard.description: 4. Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F7
standard.description: 5. Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F8
standard.description: 6. Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion); use formal English when appropriate to task and situation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438F9
standard.description: 4. Report on a topic or text or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438FA
standard.description: 5. Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11438FB
standard.description: 6. Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and situation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143911
standard.description: 4. Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143912
standard.description: 5. Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in presentations to clarify information.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143913
standard.description: 6. Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143914
standard.description: 4. Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143915
standard.description: 5. Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364891
standard.description: 6. Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143916
standard.description: 4. Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143917
standard.description: 5. Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364892
standard.description: 6. Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114391E
standard.description: 4. Present information, findings, and supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience, and task.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114391F
standard.description: 5. Make strategic use of digital media (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive elements) in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence and to add interest.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364893
standard.description: 6. Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143920
standard.description: 4. Present information, findings, and supporting evidence, conveying a clear and distinct perspective, such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning, alternative or opposing perspectives are addressed, and the organization, development, substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience, and a range of formal and informal tasks.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143921
standard.description: 5. Make strategic use of digital media (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive elements) in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence and to add interest.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2364894
standard.description: 6. Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437DF

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437E2
standard.description: 1. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437E3
standard.description: 2. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

standard.description: Knowledge of Language

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437E4
standard.description: 3. Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

standard.description: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437E5
standard.description: 4. Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437E6
standard.description: 5. Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437E8
standard.description: 6. Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437E7
standard.description: 6. Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

standard.description: Language Standards

standard.description: Conventions of Standard English

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437EC
standard.description: 1. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437ED
standard.description: a. Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437F4

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437F7

standard.description: f. Use frequently occurring adjectives.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437F9
standard.description: g. Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437FA
standard.description: h. Use determiners (e.g., articles, demonstratives).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437FB
standard.description: i. Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437FC
standard.description: j. Produce and expand complete simple and compound declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in response to prompts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365446

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143820
standard.description: d. Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143821
standard.description: e. Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic awareness and spelling conventions.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365437
standard.description: 1. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437FD
standard.description: a. Use collective nouns (e.g., group).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143802
standard.description: f. Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences (e.g., The boy watched the movie; The little boy watched the movie; The action movie was watched by the little boy).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365447
standard.description: 2. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143822

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143823
standard.description: b. Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143824
standard.description: c. Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143825
standard.description: d. Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words (e.g., cage â†’ badge; boy â†’ boil).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143826
standard.description: e. Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365438

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143803
standard.description: a. Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143804

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143808

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114380B
standard.description: i. Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

standard.description: d. Form and use possessives.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114382B

standard.description: g. Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365439
standard.description: 1. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114380F

standard.description: g. Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114382E
standard.description: a. Use correct capitalization.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114382F
standard.description: b. Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143830

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143831
standard.description: d. Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365440
standard.description: 1. Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143813

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143814
standard.description: b. Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.

standard.description: c. Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143816

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143817

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143833

standard.description: d. Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143836

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114387D

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114383E

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143840
