standard.description: 3. Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143892
standard.description: a. Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143893
standard.description: b. Maintain consistency in style and tone.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365464
standard.description: 3. Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143894
standard.description: a. Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365465
standard.description: 3. Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143895
standard.description: a. Use verbs in the active and passive voice and in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve particular effects (e.g., emphasizing the actor or the action; expressing uncertainty or describing a state contrary to fact).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143896
standard.description: 3. Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143897
standard.description: a. Write and edit work so that it conforms to the guidelines in a style manual (e.g., MLA Handbook, Turabian's Manual for Writers) appropriate for the discipline and writing type.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S2365459
standard.description: 3. Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143898
standard.description: a. Vary syntax for effect, consulting references (e.g., Tufte's Artful Sentences) for guidance as needed; apply an understanding of syntax to the study of complex texts when reading.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S11437EB
standard.description: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143841
standard.description: 4. Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143853
standard.description: a. Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143854
standard.description: b. Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143847
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143855
standard.description: a. Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143856
standard.description: b. Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143857
standard.description: c. Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143858
standard.description: d. Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143848
standard.description: 6. Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143842
standard.description: 4. Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143859
standard.description: a. Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114385A
standard.description: b. Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114385B
standard.description: c. Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143849
standard.description: 5. With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114385C
standard.description: a. Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114385D
standard.description: b. Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114385E
standard.description: c. Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are cozy).

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114385F
standard.description: d. Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S114384A
standard.description: 6. Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., because).

standard.description: a. Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

standard.name: http://asn.jesandco.org/resources/S1143863
